title: Covid-19 Pill Access at Risk as Pharmacies Push for Bigger Payments
sub_head: Government bought the pills, but dispensing fees were left up to private firms, with many pharmacies out of pocket filling the prescriptions
body:
The rollout of new Covid-19 pills has exposed a potentially costly hole in how the government and healthcare companies are managing the pandemic drug response.
Pharmacies that dispense the pills are pushing back and some are threatening to halt supplies if they donâ€™t get more funds to cover the gap.
